definition: horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: They made comments about the too-colourful waistcoats that he wore.
sentences.chinese: 他们对他色彩艳丽的马甲横加评论。

sentences.english: Though I was yet a mere child my father did not place any restriction on my wanderings.
sentences.chinese: 那时我还是个孩子，父亲对我的走动，从不横加阻拦。

sentences.english: There should be no arbitrary meddling in this process.
sentences.chinese: 在这方面，不要横加干涉。

sentences.english: Political paralysis has given rise to accusations of meddling by India.
sentences.chinese: 人们指责是印度的横加干涉导致了尼泊尔的政治瘫痪。

sentences.english: He's always making unwarranted accusations against others. His manner is intolerably aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 他动不动就对别人横加指责，气势逼人。

sentences.english: If you do anything unique, people will attack you for it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你行事很独特，人们就会对你的行为横加指责。

sentences.english: Forget the criticism about not making money with Android.
sentences.chinese: 不要再对谷歌未能利用安卓吸金而横加指责。

sentences.english: They wouldn't welcome any officious interference from the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们不会欢迎任何来自警方的横加干涉。

sentences.english: They made rude remarks about her appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他们对她的外表横加粗暴的评论。

sentences.english: That's probably better than constant meddling or overbearing behavior.
sentences.chinese: 这也许比事事横加干涉和傲慢专横的行为要好。

sentences.english: Yet they couldn't condemn the Dutch fast enough.
sentences.chinese: 然而他们却无法对荷兰横加指责。

sentences.english: Society ought to promote the exercise of virtue, not obstruct it.
sentences.chinese: 社会应让人们容易地修练德行，勿横加障碍。

sentences.english: We must not point fingers and cast blame.
sentences.chinese: 我们一定不要指指点点，横加指责。

definition: not distinguishing red-green or black-white (idiom)/not to distinguish between right and wrong
pinyin: bu4 wen4 qing1 hong2 zao4 bai2

definition: to stick up for a wrongdoer
to gesticulate while talking (idiom); to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily/also written 指手畫腳|指手画脚
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
not distinguishing black or white (idiom); not to distinguish between right and wrong
to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong/to try to turn back history/a perverse way of doing things
